column2: This law determines the ability of the Emperor to be able to usurp non-viceroyal duchies at will.
Imperial usurpation of any non-viceroyal duchies by the emperor is not allowed. The emperor may always return to this.
The emperor may usurp non-viceroyal duchies from a feudal direct vassal for any reason.
The emperor may usurp republic duchies from a republic direct vassal for any reason.
The emperor may usurp theocratic duchies from a theocratic direct vassal for any reason.
Bestow Born In The Purple Law

Born In The Purple is a trait reserved for only direct children of the Emperor who are born in the Imperial Palace. The Emperor may, under certain conditions, grant this trait to grandchildren of the Emperor.
Bestow Born In The Purple Disabled
Born In The Purple may not be bestowed outside of traditional means.
Bestow Born In The Purple Enabled

Born In The Purple is a trait reserved for only direct children of the Emperor who are born in the Imperial Palace. The Emperor may, under certain conditions, grant this trait to grandchildren of the Emperor.
The ruler may choose to permanently destroy titular titles.
The ruler may not deactivate owned titular titles.
The ruler may deactivate owned titular titles.
The ruler may choose to issue an edict, declaring titles as de jure vassals.
The ruler may not issue De Jure edicts for vassal titles.
The ruler may issue De Jure edicts for vassal duchy titles to become de jure vassals of the realm capital de jure kingdom.
The ruler may issue De Jure edicts for vassal duchy and kingdom titles.
The ruler may choose to issue an edict, declaring titles as de jure vassals.
The ruler may not issue De Jure edicts for vassal titles.
The ruler may issue De Jure edicts for vassal republic duchy titles to become de jure vassals of the realm capital de jure kingdom.
Law controlling imperial authority over trade posts within the realm.
The Empire may not seize trade posts for direct use.
The Empire may seize trade posts for direct use.
Law controlling imperial authority over Republics and trade posts within the realm.
The Empire may neither usurp republics, nor seize trade posts for direct use.
The Empire may now seize trade posts for direct use.
The Empire may now usurp Republics from vassals, as well as seize trade posts.
The Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
The Imperial Senate is not active. The Consul title is inactive.
The Imperial Senate is established. The Consul title is now active. Imperial Senate provinces may now be established.
Senators may be appointed from select Imperial provinces. Provinces must be established in turn to appoint Senators from them.
All Imperial Senate provinces are inactive.
The province of Greece is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Epirus is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Sicily is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Italy is established within the Imperial Senate.
Imperial Province of Sardinia and Corsica
The province of Sardinia and Corsica is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Baetica is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Africa is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Trebizond is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Anatolia is established within the Imperial Senate.
The Legates Augusti were literally envoys of the Emperor, governors which oversaw a specific province of the Roman Empire.
The Legates Augusti titles are inactive.
The Legates Augusti titles are enabled.
The Legates Augusti are selected from the provincial area to which they belong.
All Legates Augusti provinces are inactive.
The province of Hispania is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Gallia is established within the Legates Augusti.

The province of Egypt is established within the Legates Augusti. After Marcus Antonius was defeated and Octavian rose to power, Egypt would forever be seen as a crucial asset to the Roman Empire, distinguishing it a bit above other Legates Augusti.
The province of Germania is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Britannia is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Dalmatia is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Moesia is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Syria is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Armenia is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Arabia is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Italia is established within the Legates Augusti.
This law determines the ability of those within the realm to utilize blinding as a punishment for crimes.
Blinding may not be used as a punishment.
Blinding of a single eye may be used as a punishment.
Full blinding may be used as a punishment.
This law determines the ability of those within the realm to utilize castration as a punishment for crimes.
Castration may not be used as a punishment.
Castration may be used as a punishment.
You may give the order to partially blind §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§!.
You may give the order to permanently blind §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§!.
You may give the order to castrate §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§! and turn him into a eunuch. He will be unable to sire more spawn or be granted landed titles, a severe punishment.
column3: Vous pourriez donner l'ordre de castrer §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§! pour en faire un eunuque. Il serait incapable d'engendrer ou de recevoir des titres. Un s§v§re ch§timent.
column4: Ihr k§nnt den Befehl zum Kastrieren von §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§! erteilen und ihn so in einen Eunuchen verwandeln. Er wird danach nicht l§nger in der Lage sein Erben zu zeugen oder Besitzt§mer zu erhalten. Eine wahrlich schwere Strafe.
column6: Puedes ordenar que castren a §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§! y convertirlo en eunuco. No podr§ tener m§s descendencia ni se le conceder§n t§tulos con tierras. Un castigo muy duro.

column2: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] is released on conditional 5 year probation. [Root.GetSheHe] will no longer plot against you.
The Council's ability to vote on Class I Punishment decisions - probation, torture, and humiliation.
The Ruler has full authority on Class I punishments.
The Council may vote on Class I punishments.
The Council's ability to influence Class II Punishment decisions - mutilation, blinding, and castration.
The Ruler has full authority on Class II punishments.
The Council may vote on Class II punishments.
Bestow the Born in the Purple trait on §Y[Root.Holder.GetFullName]§!.
The Emperor may seize a Trade Post within the realm, for direct use by the Empire.

The Great Schism saw the Christian Church divided into two branches, but if all five of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy could be restored under Roman rule and the Catholic faith, there may be a chance to finally reunite Christendom.
column3: L'Église chrétienne s'est vu divisée en deux lignées par le Grand Schisme, mais si la totalité des cinq sièges épiscopaux de la Pentarchie peut être restaurée sous l'autorité de Rome et de la foi catholique, il y a peut-être une chance de réunifier enfin la chrétienté tout entière
column4: Das große Schisma sah die christliche Kirche in zwei Teile zerfallen, doch wenn alle fünf episkopalen Arme der Pentarchie wieder unter römischer Herrschaft und in katholischen Glauben vereint sind, besteht eine Chance, das Christentum wieder zu vereinen.
column6: El Gran Cisma dividió la Iglesia Cristiana en dos ramas, pero si las cinco sedes episcopales de la Pentarquía pueden ser recuperadas bajo el dominio romano y la fe católica, podría haber una oportunidad de reunir finalmente la cristiandad.

column2: Holder is §YCatholic§! and NOT a heretic\n
column3: Le détenteur est de religion §Ycatholique§! et pas hérétique\n
column6: Quien lo ostenta es §Ycatólico§! y no es hereje.\n

column2: The Great Schism is mended and Christendom reunited.
column3: Le Grand Schisme est terminé et toute la chrétienté est enfin réunifiée.
column4: Das Große Schisma wurde geheilt und das Christentum wieder vereint.
column6: El Gran Cisma se remendó y se reunió cristiandad.

column2: At last the Great Schism between the Western Catholic Church and the Eastern Orthodox Church has been mended. With the spread of Catholicism and the fall of the Pentarchy, the Orthodox faith now holds little sway over the people of Europe. There will be those who still cling to it, but they will be few in number and the Catholic Pope can finally claim universal rule over all of Christendom.
column3: Enfin, le schisme entre l'Église catholique d'Occident et l'Église orthodoxe d'Orient est terminé. Avec l'expansion du catholicisme et l'effondrement de la Pentarchie, la foi orthodoxie n'a plus la même influence sur les peuples d'Europe. Il y aura ceux qui continueront à se rattacher à elle, mais ils seront peu nombreux, et l'autorité légitime de la Pentarchie s'imposera universellement sur l'ensemble de la chrétienté.
column4: Endlich wurde das Große Schisma zwischen der westlichen katholischen Kirche und der östlichen orthodoxen Kirche geheilt. Mit der Ausbreitung Katholizismus und dem Zusammenbruch der Pentarchie, hat der orthodoxe Glaube nur noch geringen Einfluss auf die Einwohner Europas. Manche werden dem alten Glauben störrisch anhängen, aber es werden wenige sein. Die Pentarchie kann wieder behaupten, dass sie über alle Christen herrscht.
column6: Por fin, el Gran Cisma entre la Iglesia Católica Occidental y la Iglesia Ortodoxa Oriental ha sido reparado. Con la expansión del Catolicismo y colapso de la Pentarquía, la fe ortodoxa tiene ahora poca influencia sobre la gente en Europa. Habrá quienes todavía se aferren a ella, pero serán pocos en número y la  Pentarquía puede reclamar una vez más, el dominio universal sobre toda la cristiandad.

column2: If that's the way the wind is blowing...
column3: Si c'est ainsi que le vent souffle...
column6: Si esto es la dirección que el viento está soplando ...

column2: I will never give up my faith!
column3: Jamais je ne renierai ma foi !
column4: Ich werde meinen Glauben niemals aufgeben!

column2: §Y[Root.Holder.GetFullName]§! is a direct vassal or the title holder
§Y[Root.GetFullBaseName]§! is not a de jure vassal of §Y[From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullBaseName]§!
Despot is the highest honorary title in the Byzantine Empire, second only to the Emperor. It can only be granted to close relatives, traditionally the oldest son.
column3: Le despote est le plus haut titre honorifique de l'Empire byzantin, après celui d'empereur. Seuls les proches parents, traditionnellement le fils aîné, peuvent en bénéficier.
column4: Despot ist der höchste Ehrentitel im Byzantinischen Kaiserreich und untersteht nur dem Kaiser. Er kann nur engen Verwandten verliehen werden, traditionell dem ältesten Sohn.
column6: El título honorífico de déspota era el más importante del Imperio Bizantino después del de emperador. Puede otorgarse a los familiares cercanos, tradicionalmente al hijo mayor.

column2: The title of Sebastokrator was created as an even higher honor than that of 'Caesar'. It can only be granted to close relatives of the Emperor.
column3: Le titre de Sébastokrator a été créé à des fins encore plus honorifique que celui de 'César'. Il est réservé aux proches parents de l'empereur.
column4: Der Titel Sebastokrator war mit noch höherer Ehre als der eines "Cäsar" verbunden. Er kann nur engen Verwandten des Kaisers verliehen werden.
column6: El título de sebastocrátor tenía aún más honor que el de césar. Solo puede otorgarse a los familiares cercanos del emperador.

column2: Originally the highest honor in the Roman Empire, the title of Caesar can now be awarded to anyone.
column3: Plus haut titre de l'Empire romain, le titre de César peut désormais être décerné à tout le monde.
column4: Ursprünglich war der Cäsartitel der ehrenvollste im Römischen Kaiserreich, jetzt aber kann er jedermann verliehen werden.
column6: Originalmente, era el título con más honor del Imperio Romano, aunque hoy en día puede otorgarse a cualquiera.

column2: Kouropalates - 'the One in Charge of the Palace' - is a very prestigious title in the Byzantine Empire.
column3: Curopalate - 'celui qui a la charge du palais' est un prestigieux titre de l'Empire byzantin.
column4: Kouropalates - "der Palastverwalter" - ist im Byzantinischen Kaiserreich ein äußerst angesehener Titel.
column6: El título de curopalates (el encargado del palacio) es bastante prestigioso en el Imperio Bizantino.

column2: Anthypatos is Greek for Proconsul. However, the office no longer denotes a provincial governor but is purely honorary.
column3: Anthypathos est un terme grec qui signifie proconsul. Toutefois, ce titre ne désigne plus un gouverneur provincial, et s'avère purement honorifique.
column4: Anthypathos ist der griechische Ausdruck für Prokonsul. Dieses Amt steht aber nicht mehr für einen Provinzgouverneur, sondern ist lediglich ein Ehrentitel.
column6: Anthypathos viene del griego y significa procónsul. Sin embargo, el cargo ya no es para los gobernadores de la provincia, sino que es meramente honorífico.

column2: Consul: Though only honorary now, it denotes the wearer as an important servant of the Empire.
column3: Bien que seulement honorifique à présent, ce titre de consul est octroyé à un important serviteur de l'Empire.
column4: Konsul: Obwohl es nur ehrenamtlich ist, bezeichnet es den Träger als einen wichtigen Diener des Reiches.
column6: Cónsul: aunque ahora solo es honorífico, señala a su portador como un servidor importante del imperio.

column2: Patrician: Recognizes the wearer as an elite member of Roman Society and is reserved for only the most influential servants of the Empire.
column3: Membre d'élite patricien de la société romaine, le titre est réservé aux serviteurs les plus influents de l'Empire.
column4: Patrizier: Zeichnet den Träger als Mitglied der Elite innerhalb der römischen Gesellschaft aus und ist nur den einflussreichsten Dienern des Reiches vorbehalten.
column6: Patricio: reconoce al portador como miembro de élite de la sociedad romana y se reserva solamente para los servidores más influyentes del imperio.

column2: Venerable one: Only important members of the imperial family and those related to them by marriage or blood may bear this venerable title.
column3: Seuls les membres importants de la famille impériale et ceux qui leur sont liés par le mariage ou le sang peuvent porter ce titre vénérable.
column4: Ehrwürdiger: Nur wichtige Mitglieder der kaiserlichen Familie und diejenigen, die durch Ehe oder Blut mit ihnen verwandt sind, dürfen diesen ehrwürdigen Titel tragen.
column6: Venerable: solo miembros importantes de la familia imperial y aquellas personas relacionadas con ellos por matrimonio o sangre pueden llevar este venerable título.

column2: Most Pious Augusta: Unlike the male counterpart the Augusta continues to be the most important woman of the empire. Wielding great power and authority, she is second only to the Basileus.
column3: Contrairement à son homologue masculin, Augusta reste la femme la plus importante de l'Empire. Dotée d'un grand pouvoir et d'une grande autorité, elle est la deuxième après le Basileus.
column4: Frommste Augusta: Im Gegensatz zu den Männern ist die Augusta nach wie vor die wichtigste Frau des Reiches. Mit großer Macht und Autorität ist sie nach dem Basileus die zweitwichtigste Person des Reiches.
column6: La más pía augusta: al contrario que sus contrapartidas masculinas, la augusta sigue siendo la mujer más importante del imperio, ejerciendo un gran poder y autoridad solo por debajo del Basileos.

column2: The realm Houndmaster maintains the hunting and guard dogs.
The Tresviri Capitales are a council of three which manage the carrying out of executions in the Byzantine Empire.
The Tresviri Epulones are a council of three priests which manages public banquets in the Byzantine Empire.
The Tresviri Monetales are a council of three which manages the minting of coins in the Byzantine Empire.

The Consul was a member of the Imperial Senate, often appointed by the Emperor, to oversee Senate proceedings with the Emperor, and to see to the Senate on the Emperor's behalf. While in real life there were two, in game the Emperor is limited to one.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
The Legatus Hispania is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Hispania.
The Legatus Gallia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Gallia.

The Praefectus Aegyptus is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Aegyptus. It is similar to a Legatus Augusti title, but is a higher honor. After Marcus Antonius was defeated and Octavian rose to power, Egypt would forever be seen as a crucial asset to the Roman Empire.
The Legatus Germania is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Germania.
The Legatus Britannia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Britannia.
The Legatus Dalmatia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Dalmatia.
The Legatus Moesia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Moesia.
The Legatus Syria is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Syria.
The Legatus Armenia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Armenia.
The Legatus Arabia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Arabia.
The Legatus Italia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Italia.
The ruler has proclaimed an edict, shifting the de jure allegiance of a vassal.
This ruler has bestowed the Born in the Purple trait upon a grandchild.
The ruler has seized a trade post, annoying their vassals.
This character has been released from prison on a conditional probation. They will not take hostile actions against their former jailer.
The Theodosian Walls were built during the reign of Emperor Theodosius II in the early 5th century, but they still remain some of the most formidable fortifications ever built by human hands.

column2: The Theodosian Walls were built during the reign of Emperor Theodosius II in the early 5th century, but they still remain some of the most formidable fortifications ever built by human hands.
column3: Le Mur Théodosien a été érigé au cours du règne de l'empereur Théodosius II au début du Ve siècle. Même aujourd'hui, c'est toujours parmi la plus formidable fortification jamais construite par l'homme.
column4: Die Theodosische Mauer wurde während der Herrschaft des Kaisers Theodosius II im frühen fünften Jahrhundert gebaut, aber sie ist noch immer eine der bemerkenswertesten Befestigungen, welche jemals durch Menschen errichtet wurden.
column6: Las Murallas Teodosianas fueron construidas durante el reinado del emperador Teodosio II, a inicios del siglo V, pero aún son una de las fortificaciones más formidables construidas por el hombre.

column2: Carries out administration of the Trade Post on behalf of the Empire.
column3: Effectue l'administration du poste de traite au nom de l'Empire.
column4: Führt die Verwaltung des Handelspostens im Namen des Imperiums durch.
column6: Lleva a cabo la administración del Puesto Comercial en nombre del Imperio.
